name: deimosrising
text: Before he was a PI, Magnum raised ponies.

name: apocowarg
text: and lived in the Middle Ages or Hyrule.

name: em2
text: Rockford had a unicorn.

name: reburn
text: Colombo had a Pegasus he consulted on particularly difficult cases.

name: mystkmanat
text: When I was a little girl in Poland, everyone had ponies!

name: mantasmicdude
text: Pony Investigator.

name: lucid
text: You really have to be able to hear Tom Selleck's voice saying the words. It makes it so much better.

name: wazza
text: Magnum, Pony Incubator

name: zem
text: Philippe is pretty well established here

name: ambala
text: I would like to give Phillipe a pony.

name: saint
text: that is a lie the naked girl on my screen cannot be a good person because of what she is doing to the other naked girl.

name: ralgnar
text: She's not exactly hiding, either.

name: spectre
text: A comment left by spectre was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, riotdejaneiro, Manxome, dismas, goocifer, hcaz, Magreaux_Dogg, scraggg, TheQuietYou)

name: killerlimpet
text: okay.

name: bassguitarbill
text:
You mean that naked girl that I...

BONED?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i doubt she'd be into that.

name: sargasm
text: Lie Bot does something good for once!  It must have been unintentional.

name: rowboat
text: LIE BOT LIES TO MAKE GOOD.

name: redjoker
text: lie bot doesnt lie for the sake of trivial matters like good or evil. he lies to uphold the purity of lying.

name: rational
text: I disagree. Lie Bot's absolution of technology may have contributed to a certain close call involving Philippe, a computer, and a bad bad man .

name: gouldgonewild
text: I disagree again. Someone else said it, and I must reiterate. Liebot lies for the sake of lying, he is morally ambiguous and apathetic

name: tombsgrave
text: I STILL have dreams like this.

name: max
text: This is one of the better things about computers.

name: patkun
text: I love the way that Phillipe reacts to the this idea not with alarm, but with a deep sense of sadness (panel 3)

name: joeyramoney
text: i love phillipes' expression when he gets the news. he doesn't look alarmed or fearful, but rather disappointed, as if he just learned the truth about the tooth fairy.

name: joeyramoney
text: i apologize to patkun for not reading all of the comments before adding this one and thus looking like an ass.

name: molesticide
text:
honestly i don't support the concept of forum-based social contrivance. like should you scoop toward or away when you get to the bottom of the soup bowl, WHO GIVES A SHIT. so two people said the same thing, nearly at once. achewood attracts a certain kind of readership, and there aren't as many of us as there are dilbert fans. it's bound to happen; let it be an awkward chuckle, i don't think it's necessary to mention it.

yeah, i'm PROUD of being an asshole.

name: hamscout
text:
truly I do not get behind the idea of thread-founded community creation.
it is to debate whether to wipe back-to-front or vice versa, WHO F-ING CARES? chance brought two souls together to trip upon the same thought, well-nigh simultaneously. achewood captivates a unique audience, though attendance may fall short of the champions of engineering humorists. Happenstance will have it's way; let us gaze bemused on the occurrence, i don't think we needs must acknowledge it...

...oh fuck, while I was typing that, he... oh shiiiiiiiit!

name: brzbee
text: I believe this is the first of Philippe's bizzare childish fanasies. Love it.

name: shoinan
text: Columbo hides in an Amiga 500.

name: epicurus
text:
God do I ever love Columbo.

That is all.

name: redjoker
text: Just one more thing...

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Now I'm hearing Liebot in Columbo's voice, which is terrifying. Columbo would never lie.

name: epicurus
text:
Oh no sir. I wouldn't lie to you. It's just... these little things, sir. Little ... details. They bother me. Like for instance you heard the shot at 8:30, and then you ran outside and got in your car and drove down here to the guard house by 8:32. Now what I can't figure is how you had time to lace those boots of yours, sir - I tried 'em, it never took me less than two minutes! Of course I'm all thumbs, I'm always dropping things around the house - my wife always says that if I had to work with my hands fora living I'd - oh what's that sir? Oh, you didn't lace them up.

Oh yeah, of course. Didn't lace 'em. Well there you have it. Well, I'll be in touch if you need me.

Oh, and just one more thing sir...

name: agentj
text: This makes me think of a nintendo Super Magnum World game. Ferrari that eats/lays eggs and all.

name: deusoma
text: Sweet mother of God why wasn't this made?

name: gmm
text: Well that is basically the worst lie you could ever tell a kid with an internet connection

name: tom-ba
text: Yes, that is the genius of Lie Bot.

name: cjsalt
text: THESE KNIVES

name: woodenteeth
text: THESE KNIVES

name: epicurus
text: No.

name: woodenteeth
text: Good call.

name: smaconi
text: Tom Selleck = automatic 5.
